results.title: The Day After
results.brief_description: The Day After strips much of the myth from atomic murder to reveal with stark reality the catastrophe of a nuclear holocaust and its torturous effect on a group of average “survivors”. A moving and devastating drama about the effects of nuclear was on the citizens of Lawrence, Kansas. Rated: PG

results.title: The Day
results.brief_description: This storyteller talks about the devastating day that she lost the most important person in her life - her Nan. Made as part of the “Pride and Diversity” workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: The Dawns here are quiet = A Zori Zdes Tikhiye
results.creator_credit: Stanislav Rostotsky, G Natanson and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Set in WW2, Karelia, northwest Russia, this elegiac war drama is about a small group of female soldiers in training, who are unexpectedly called upon to face a Nazi patrol of paratroopers. The narrative sensitively portrays the women’s camaraderie, as well as their pre-war domestic life, and spousal relationships. A fine ensemble cast heads what is widely regarded as powerful statement about war and society, and the sacrifices of ordinary citizens made in extraordinary times. Based on a true story and adapted from the book by Boris Vasilyev. Also known as “At Dawn its quiet here” and “That Dawn should be peaceful”.

results.title: The Dawn patrol
results.creator_credit: Edmund Goulding, Turner Entertainment and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Errol Flynn and David Niven are daring, roustabout fighter pilot buddies, who whether quaffing down ales with their squadron or gunning down their German foes, unite in devil-may-care gallantry and a spirit of camaraderie that is easy to understand. They quickly snap-to as they come face to face with the harsh realities of war, learning a great deal about friendship, heroism and patriotism in the process. During the fateful months of 1915, the average life of combat pilots over the western front was only four and a half flying hours, as raw and hastily trained recruits were sent up in a constant deadly chain to almost certain death, as soon as they reported for duty. Basil Rathbone and Donald Crisp co-star as grounded commandants whose duty it is to send these fresh faced recruits to their flying deaths. A splendid remake of Howard Hawks’ 1930 Oscar winner, this film aptly captures the pervading tone of wartime camaraderie and the gruelling pressures of battlefront command, and remains at the top of Hollywood’s finest aviation epics.

results.title: The Dawn of motoring
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, John Wiles, Films of Today and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: Part one of a 6-part series “History of the motor car”. Covers the development of the motorcar from the invention of the wheel to 1895 when the first cars produced in commercial quantities appeared on the roads.

results.title: The Dawn of industry
results.creator_credit: Derek Stewart Productions, Gerard Bryant and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The history of the hovercraft’s development including an interview with its inventor, Christopher Cockerell. Various uses, both commercial and military, are shown, and some of its posible future applications are described.

results.title: The Dawn of Happiness
results.brief_description: A country as enigmatic as any in the Orient is the location for this adventure trip of a lifetime, where we see first hand the roots of modern Thailand. Starting in Bangkok, travel north upstream to Aeutia in the Chao Phraya River in search of the incredible Hill tribes of Northern Thailand, who are found in one of the most remote areas in the country between the borders of Burma and Laos. Upon arrival witness a wedding ceremony - a magnificent display of clothing and jewellery, highlighting the fascinating rituals and traditions of these ancient people. Further on the journey, visit Naoon Suan - one of the largest rice markets in the world, along with Subotai and Chiang Mai, two of the most fascinating cities in Thailand.

results.title: The Davis Cup, 1951
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s fight to retain the world tennis premiership. The film covers the Interzone Final in Melbourne between Sweden and the USA and the Challenge Round in Sydney between the USA and Australia. Narrated by Michael Charlton and Peter Whitchurch.

results.title: The Date: an interactive movie
results.brief_description: Based on the ‘choose your own adventure’ books from the 1980’s, the outcome of this interactive movie rests with the user. The shy boy central character has managed to score a date with the girl of his dreams - it is up to the user to determine whether he is successful or a miserable failure.
